meanings.definition: Gathered or clustered together in a close group.
meanings.sent1: The agminate berries on the bush looked like a bunch of tiny grapes.
meanings.sent2: The agminate stars in the sky formed beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent3: The agminate ducks waddled in a line, looking like a feathered parade.
meanings.sent4: The agminate leaves on the tree created a dense canopy, blocking out the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The agminate crowd at the concert cheered in unison, creating a wave of excitement.

meanings.definition: To gather or cluster together in a close group.
meanings.sent1: The students agminate around the teacher to hear the exciting news.
meanings.sent2: Birds agminate on the power lines during migration season.
meanings.sent3: The ants agminate around the fallen cookie, forming a busy assembly line.
meanings.sent4: People agminate near the stage to catch a glimpse of the famous singer.
meanings.sent5: Clouds agminate in the sky before a storm, darkening the horizon.
